pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:0.4.eng: 11. The training rule on supporting a schism

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto saṅghabhedāya parakkamati cakkabhedāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.2.eng: At that time Devadatta was pursuing schism in the Sangha, a break in authority.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.4.eng: “Devadatta speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.4.comm: “Training” renders vinaya. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.5.pli: Kathañhi nāma devadatto saṅghabhedāya parakkamissati cakkabhedāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.5.eng: How can he pursue schism in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.6.pli: Evaṃ vutte, kokāliko kaṭamodakatissako khaṇḍadeviyā putto samuddadatto te bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.6.eng: But Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyāputta, and Samuddadatta said to those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.8.eng: Devadatta speaks in accordance with the Teaching and the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.9.pli: Amhākañca devadatto chandañca ruciñca ādāya voharati jānāti no bhāsati amhākampetaṃ khamatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.9.eng: And he speaks with our consent and approval. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.10.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū devadattassa saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā bhavissanti vaggavādakā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.11.eng: “How can these monks support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.12.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te anuvattake bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.12.eng: They rebuked those monks in many ways and then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū devadattassa saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā honti vaggavādakā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who support this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā devadattassa saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā bhavissanti vaggavādakā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.16.eng: “Monks, how can those foolish men support this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.18.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.19.1.pli: “Tasseva kho pana bhikkhussa bhikkhū honti anuvattakā vaggavādakā eko vā dve vā tayo vā. Te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.19.1.eng: ‘That monk may have one, two, or three monks who side with him and support him, and they may say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.21.pli: Dhammavādī ceso bhikkhu, vinayavādī ceso bhikkhu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.21.eng: He speaks in accordance with the Teaching and the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.22.pli: Amhākañceso bhikkhu chandañca ruciñca ādāya voharati jānāti no bhāsati amhākampetaṃ khamatī’ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.22.eng: And he speaks with our consent and approval. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.23.eng: The monks should correct those monks like this,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.25.pli: na ceso bhikkhu dhammavādī, na ceso bhikkhu vinayavādī,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.25.eng: this monk speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.26.eng: And don’t consent to schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.27.pli: sametāyasmantānaṃ saṅghena, samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsu viharatī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.27.eng: Stay with the Sangha, for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.28.pli: Evañca te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi vuccamānā tatheva paggaṇheyyuṃ, te bhikkhū bhikkhūhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbā tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.28.eng: If those monks still continue as before, the monks should press them up to three times to make them stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.29.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsiyamānā taṃ paṭinissajjeyyuṃ, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.29.eng: If they then stop, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.30.eng: If they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.2.eng: that monk who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.6.pli: yaṃdiṭṭhiko so hoti yaṅkhantiko yaṃruciko tepi taṃdiṭṭhikā honti taṅkhantikā taṃrucikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.6.eng: they have the same view, the same belief, the same persuasion as he does.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.8.eng: they praise him and take his side.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.9.pli: Eko vā dve vā tayo vāti

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.10.pli: eko vā hoti dve vā tayo vā. Te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.10.eng: there is one, or two, or three. They may say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.11.pli: “māyasmanto etaṃ bhikkhuṃ kiñci avacuttha, dhammavādī ceso bhikkhu, vinayavādī ceso bhikkhu,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.11.eng: “Venerables, don’t correct this monk. He speaks in accordance with the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.11.comm: “Correct” renders avacuttha. See vadati in Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion of this word.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.12.pli: amhākañceso bhikkhu chandañca ruciñca ādāya voharati jānāti no bhāsati amhākampetaṃ khamatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.12.eng: And he speaks with our consent and approval. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.14.eng: those monks who side with him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.16.pli: aññehi bhikkhūhi. Ye passanti ye suṇanti tehi vattabbā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.16.eng: other monks, those who see it or hear about it. They should correct them like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.18.pli: Na ceso bhikkhu dhammavādī, na ceso bhikkhu vinayavādī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.18.eng: this monk speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.19.eng: And don’t consent to schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.21.pli: Samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsu viharatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.21.eng: for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.22.eng: And they should correct them a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.24.eng: If they stop, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.25.eng: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.26.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.27.eng: Those monks, even if they have to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.29.pli: Na ceso bhikkhu dhammavādī, na ceso bhikkhu vinayavādī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.29.eng: this monk speaks contrary to the Teaching and the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.30.eng: And don’t consent to schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.32.pli: Samaggo hi saṅgho sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsu viharatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.32.eng: for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—is at ease.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.33.eng: They should correct them a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.35.eng: If they stop, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.36.eng: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.38.eng: “And, monks, they should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.39.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.40.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.41.pli: Itthannāmo ca itthanāmo ca bhikkhū itthannāmassa bhikkhuno saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā vaggavādakā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.41.eng: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.42.eng: And they keep on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.43.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhū samanubhāseyya tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.43.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press them to make them stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.45.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.46.pli: Itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca bhikkhū itthannāmassa bhikkhuno saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā vaggavādakā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.46.eng: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.47.eng: And they keep on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.48.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhū samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.48.eng: The Sangha presses them to make them stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.49.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa ca itthannāmassa ca bhikkhūnaṃ samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.49.eng: Any monk who approves of pressing them to make them stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.50.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.51.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.52.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.53.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.54.pli: Itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca bhikkhū itthannāmassa bhikkhuno saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā vaggavādakā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.54.eng: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.55.eng: And they keep on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.56.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmañca itthannāmañca bhikkhū samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.56.eng: The Sangha presses them to make them stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.57.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa ca itthannāmassa ca bhikkhūnaṃ samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.57.eng: Any monk who approves of pressing them to make them stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.58.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.59.pli: Samanubhaṭṭhā saṅghena itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca bhikkhū tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.59.eng: The Sangha has pressed monks so-and-so and so-and-so to make them stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.60.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.62.eng: After the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.62.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.63.eng: After each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.64.eng: When the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.65.pli: Saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpajjantānaṃ ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ, dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā paṭippassambhanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.65.eng: For those who commit the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.66.pli: Dve tayo ekato samanubhāsitabbā, taduttari na samanubhāsitabbā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.66.eng: Two or three may be pressed together, but not more than that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.67.eng: They commit an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.68.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī na paṭinissajjanti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, and they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematikā na paṭinissajjanti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but they are unsure of it, and they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī na paṭinissajjanti, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as illegitimate, and they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they are unsure of it, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.2.eng: if they have not been pressed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.6.eng: if they are overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.7.eng: if they are the first offenders.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.8.eng: The training rule on supporting a schism, the eleventh, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:0.4.eng: 12. The training rule on being difficult to correct

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā channo anācāraṃ ācarati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.7.pli: “kiṃ nu kho nāma tumhe, āvuso, maṃ vattabbaṃ maññatha?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.9.eng: The Buddha is mine; the Teaching is mine.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.10.eng: The Master realized the Truth because of me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.11.pli: Seyyathāpi nāma mahāvāto vāyanto tiṇakaṭṭhapaṇṇasaṭaṃ ekato ussāreyya, seyyathā vā pana nadī pabbateyyā saṅkhasevālapaṇakaṃ ekato ussāreyya;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.11.eng: Just as grass, sticks, and fallen leaves are whirled up by a strong wind all at once, just as various water plants are whirled up by a mountain stream all at once,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.12.pli: evameva tumhe nānānāmā nānāgottā nānājaccā nānākulā pabbajitā ekato ussāritā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.12.eng: so too have you–after going forth with various names, various families, various castes, various households–been lifted up all at once.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.13.pli: Kiṃ nu kho nāma tumhe, āvuso, maṃ vattabbaṃ maññatha?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.13.eng: So, who are you to correct me?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.15.eng: The Buddha is mine; the Teaching is mine.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.16.eng: The Master realized the Truth because of me.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.16.comm: For the further development of these events, see Kd 11:25.1.1–31.1.219.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.17.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.17.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.18.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā channo bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.18.eng: “How can Venerable Channa make himself incorrigible when he’s legitimately corrected by the monks?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.19.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ channaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.19.eng: They rebuked Channa in many ways and then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.20.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, channa, bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karosī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.20.eng: “Is it true, Channa, that you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.23.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.23.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.25.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.25.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.26.1.pli: “Bhikkhu paneva dubbacajātiko hoti uddesapariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.26.1.eng: ‘If a monk is difficult to correct, and he makes himself incorrigible when legitimately corrected by the monks concerning the training rules that are recited, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.27.pli: ‘mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, ahampāyasmante na kiñci vakkhāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.27.eng: “Venerables, don’t say anything to me, either good or bad, and I won’t say anything to you, either good or bad.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.29.eng: then the monks should correct him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.30.pli: ‘māyasmā attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ akāsi, vacanīyamevāyasmā attānaṃ karotu,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.30.eng: “Be easy to correct, venerable, not incorrigible.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.31.pli: āyasmāpi bhikkhū vadetu sahadhammena, bhikkhūpi āyasmantaṃ vakkhanti sahadhammena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.31.eng: And please give legitimate correction to the monks, and the monks will do the same to you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.32.pli: Evaṃ saṃvaddhā hi tassa bhagavato parisā yadidaṃ aññamaññavacanena aññamaññavuṭṭhāpanenā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.32.eng: For it’s in this way that the Buddha’s community has grown, that is, through mutual correction and mutual clearing of offenses.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.33.pli: Evañca so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi vuccamāno tatheva paggaṇheyya, so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsitabbo tassa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.33.eng: If that monk continues as before, the monks should press him up to three times to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.34.pli: Yāvatatiyañce samanubhāsiyamāno taṃ paṭinissajjeyya, iccetaṃ kusalaṃ;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.34.eng: If he then stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:1.35.eng: If he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.1.eng: If a monk is difficult to correct:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.2.pli: dubbaco hoti dovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgato akkhamo appadakkhiṇaggāhī anusāsaniṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.2.eng: if he is hard to correct, endowed with qualities that make him hard to correct, resistant, not receiving instructions respectfully.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.3.eng: Concerning the training rules that are recited:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.4.eng: concerning the training rules of the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.8.pli: yaṃ bhagavatā paññattaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ, etaṃ sahadhammikaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.8.eng: the training rules laid down by the Buddha—this is called “legitimately”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.9.eng: When corrected in regard to this, he makes himself incorrigible, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.10.pli: “mā maṃ āyasmanto kiñci avacuttha kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā, ahampāyasmante na kiñci vakkhāmi kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā. Viramathāyasmanto mama vacanāyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.10.eng: “Venerables, don’t say anything to me, either good or bad, and I won’t say anything to you, either good or bad. Please refrain from correcting me.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.12.eng: the monk who is difficult to correct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.14.pli: aññehi bhikkhūhi. Ye passanti ye suṇanti tehi vattabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.14.eng: other monks, those who see it or hear about it. They should correct him like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.15.eng: “Be easy to correct, venerable, not incorrigible.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.17.pli: Āyasmāpi bhikkhū vadetu sahadhammena, bhikkhūpi āyasmantaṃ vakkhanti sahadhammena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.17.eng: And please give legitimate correction to the monks, and the monks will do the same to you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.18.pli: Evaṃ saṃvaddhā hi tassa bhagavato parisā yadidaṃ aññamaññavacanena aññamaññavuṭṭhāpanenā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.18.eng: For it’s in this way that the Buddha’s community has grown, that is, through mutual correction and mutual clearing of offenses.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.19.eng: And they should correct him a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.21.eng: If he stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.22.eng: If he does not stop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.23.eng: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.24.eng: That monk, even if he has to be pulled into the Sangha, should be corrected like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.25.eng: “Be easy to correct, venerable, not incorrigible. And please give legitimate correction to the monks, and the monks will do the same to you. For it’s in this way that the Buddha’s community has grown, that is, through mutual correction

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.27.eng: They should correct him a second

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.29.eng: If he stops, all is well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.30.eng: If he does not stop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.32.eng: “And, monks, he should be pressed like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.33.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.34.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.35.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.35.eng: The monk so-and-so makes himself incorrigible when legitimately corrected by the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.36.eng: And he keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.37.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāseyya tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.37.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should press him to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.39.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.40.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.40.eng: The monk so-and-so makes himself incorrigible when legitimately corrected by the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.41.eng: And he keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.42.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.42.eng: The Sangha presses him to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.43.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.43.eng: Any monk who approves of pressing him to make him stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.44.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.45.eng: For the second time, I speak on this matter. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.46.eng: For the third time, I speak on this matter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.47.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.48.pli: Ayaṃ itthannāmo bhikkhu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.48.eng: The monk so-and-so makes himself incorrigible when legitimately corrected by the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.49.eng: And he keeps on doing it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.50.pli: Saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ samanubhāsati tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.50.eng: The Sangha presses him to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.51.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno samanubhāsanā tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.51.eng: Any monk who approves of pressing him to make him stop should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.52.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.53.pli: Samanubhaṭṭho saṅghena itthannāmo bhikkhu tassa vatthussa paṭinissaggāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.53.eng: The Sangha has pressed monk so-and-so to make him stop.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.54.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.56.eng: After the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.56.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, an offense. Yet just below the text says that the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.57.eng: After each of the first two announcements, he commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.58.eng: When the last announcement is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.59.pli: Saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpajjantassa ñattiyā dukkaṭaṃ, dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā paṭippassambhanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.59.eng: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.60.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:2.61.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, but he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he does not stop, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.1.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.2.2.eng: if he has not been pressed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.2.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss12:3.2.6.eng: The  training rule on being difficult to correct, the twelfth, is finished.
